channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Justice Department opens antitrust probe into egg price spike
item.description: The investigation focuses on whether companies including Cal-Maine Foods and Rose Acre Farms have colluded to boost prices or limit supply.

item.title: Stocks end higher on Powell remarks, but S&P 500 still posts worst week of 2025
Thinking of buying the stock-market dip? Here’s what you should know.
Social Security’s acting chief privately admits DOGE ‘will make mistakes’ as cuts delay processing of claims, report says
item.description: "DOGE people are learning and they will make mistakes, but we have to let them see what is going on at SSA."

item.title: DoorDash’s stock pops on S&P 500 nod. Here’s who else is joining the index.
‘America First’ policies are threatening American exceptionalism as the economy and markets flash warning signs
item.description: "We are still betting on the resilience of consumers and the economy. However, Trump Turmoil 2.0 is significantly testing the resilience of both."

item.title: Social Security to increase overpayment withholdings to 100% from 10%
Once hailed by Obama as a ‘Champion of Change,’ DOGE’s chief may be wielding extraordinary power—or not—as role remains a mystery
item.description: The uncertainty over her role — and when she was appointed to it — could have far-reaching implications in a series of ongoing lawsuits.

item.title: Most Americans don’t matter to the economy like they used to
Vladimir Putin’s ruling party gives meat grinders to mothers of soldiers killed in Ukraine as gifts
item.description: Russia is often accused of throwing its frontline soldiers into a "meat grinder" with scant regard for their lives.
